pageProps.description: In this guide, we'll look at how authentication works. Protocol offers two ways to authenticate your API requests: Basic authentication and OAuth2 with a token.

ensLibraries.name: Wagmi
ensLibraries.description: wagmi is a collection of React Hooks containing everything you need to start working with Ethereum. wagmi makes it easy to "Connect Wallet," display ENS and balance information, sign messages, interact with contracts, and much more

ensLibraries.name: Ethers
ensLibraries.description: The ethers.js library aims to be a complete and compact library for interacting with the Ethereum Blockchain and its ecosystem.

ensLibraries.name: ENSjs
ensLibraries.description: The ultimate ENS javascript library, with ethers.js under the hood.

ensLibraries.name: Web3.js
ensLibraries.description: web3.js is a collection of libraries that allow you to interact with a local or remote ethereum node using HTTP, IPC or WebSocket.

ensLibraries.name: Nethereum
ensLibraries.description: Nethereum is the .Net integration library for Ethereum, simplifying the access and smart contract interaction with Ethereum nodes both public or permissioned like Geth, Parity or Quorum.

ensLibraries.name: web3j
ensLibraries.description: Web3j is a highly modular, reactive, type safe Java and Android library for working with Smart Contracts and integrating with clients (nodes) on the Ethereum network.

ensLibraries.name: go-ens
ensLibraries.description: Go module to simplify interacting with the Ethereum Name Service contracts.

ensLibraries.name: ethereal
ensLibraries.description: A command-line tool for managing common tasks in Ethereum.

ensLibraries.name: delphereum
ensLibraries.description: web3 implementation for the Delphi programming language.

pageProps.title: Libraries
